Name: Grape Isariopsis Leaf Spot
Description: Grape Isariopsis Leaf Spot, also known as Isariopsis Leaf Stain, is a fungal disease that affects grapevines. It is caused by the fungus Isariopsis griseola, and can result in significant crop losses if left untreated. The symptoms of Grape Isariopsis Leaf Spot include the appearance of small, circular or angular spots on the leaves of grapevines. These spots are initially yellow or light green, but can turn brown or black as the disease progresses. The spots may also have a reddish-purple halo around them, and can cause the leaves to curl and become distorted.

Treatments.Cultural practices: Practices such as maintaining good canopy management, reducing the use of overhead irrigation, and avoiding excessive nitrogen fertilization can also help reduce the severity of the disease.

Treatments.Use fungicides: Fungicides containing the active ingredients azoxystrobin or pyraclostrobin may be effective in reducing the severity of Grape Isariopsis Leaf Spot when applied preventatively.

Products.Azoxystrobin: Azoxystrobin is a systemic fungicide that is effective against Isariopsis griseola when applied preventatively. Examples of products containing azoxystrobin include Abound, Quadris, and Heritage.

Products.Pyraclostrobin: Pyraclostrobin is a broad-spectrum fungicide that is also effective against Isariopsis griseola when applied preventatively. Examples of products containing pyraclostrobin include Cabrio, Pristine, and Headline.
